meanings.definition: A dog trained to retrieve game birds.
meanings.sent1: My neighbor's birddogs are always excited to go hunting.
meanings.sent2: The birddogs at the competition were well-behaved and skilled.
meanings.sent3: The birddogs decided to take a break and chase their tails instead of birds.
meanings.sent4: The birddogs moved swiftly through the field, like graceful dancers.
meanings.sent5: The birddogs' keen sense of smell helps them locate hidden birds easily.

meanings.definition: To seek out or follow closely.
meanings.sent1: The detective decided to birddog the suspect to gather more evidence.
meanings.sent2: I always birddog my favorite singer's tour dates to make sure I don't miss a show.
meanings.sent3: The kids thought it would be fun to birddog their teacher around the school.
meanings.sent4: The reporter would birddog the politician's every move to catch any slip-ups.
meanings.sent5: The paparazzi would birddog the celebrity, hoping for a scandalous photo.
